Class CourseController

java.lang.Object
edu.missouristate.taschedulegenerator.controllers.CourseController

public class CourseController
extends Object
implements SceneManager.Controller<Course>, javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for the courseInfo scene.
Author:
Noah Geren, Corey Rusher

  • Method Details

    • cancel

      public void cancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Cancels creating/editing a course. Returns back to dashboard scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered this method.
      See Also:
      SceneManager

    • addActivity

      public void addActivity​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Validates the current activity fields. If valid then it adds the activity to the course's activity list.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered this method.

    • saveCourseInfo

      public void saveCourseInfo​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Validates course info fields. If valid then either saves the the new course or updates the course being edited.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered this method.

    • initData

      public void initData​(Course course)
      Initializes data for the courseInfo scene.
      Specified by:
      initData in interface SceneManager.Controller<Course>
      Parameters:
      course - The course that is being edited. Should be null if creating a new course.

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Setups up any fields or tables that are included in the scene.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • clearActivityInputs

      private void clearActivityInputs()
      Clears the activity input fields.

    • validate

      private boolean validate()
      Validates the course info fields. Course code and instructor name cannot be empty. There also must be at least one activity.
      Returns:
      True if the course info fields are valid.

    • validateActivity

      private boolean validateActivity()
      Validates the activity info fields.
      Returns:
      True if the activity fields are valid.
